fields.text: ...the sun gets in your eyes as you turn into the gravel lot. You pull down the visor and your vision comes back. There's a dock to the north of you that stretches over a large body of water. The road that you came from stretches back to the east. The digital clock on the dashboard reads 2:14 as you bring the truck to a stop. Edelweiss is playing on the radio—you think of stiff suits and fumbling through a waltz.
You search the truck and find a lockbox hidden under the back seat.

You are standing on the dock facing north, looking out on a large lake. The eastern and western sides of the lake are bordered by mountains. A cherry red plane is wrecked in the center of the lake, about 1 km north of you. Even further to the north, you see a glacier supplying water to the lake. A kayak is floating next to the dock.

You are standing outside of the truck. You can read the clock from the outside of the car. It reads 11:59. Edelweiss is playing on the radio and you can faintly smell roses. The dock is to the north. The road you came from stretches to the east.
You look inside the lockbox. You find a piece of paper and a small diamond. You take both.
There is a paddle inside the kayak. The bright red plane to the north sticks out against the glacier behind it.

As you approach the crashed plane on your kayak, you see a man sitting on one of the wings. He’s old, thin, and wearing a full tuxedo. He watches you as you approach and says nothing.  You also notice the strange fish that are circling the plane in the water. The glacier is to the north. There is a rhythmic pulsing sound coming from a cave to the west. You see woods on the shore to the east. The dock is to the south.

You climb onto the plane and take a seat next to the man. After a seemingly long silence, he leans over and shows you the pocket watch in his hand. It reads 7:18. He nods to the water and says “You’re gonna have to get in at some point you know. It won’t be easy but… I don’t make up the rules. If you’ve got anything valuable, feel free to show me first. Four should be enough to make things go a bit smoother.”

You’re in the kayak by the plane. The man is watching you and the fish are circling. The glacier is to the north. There is a rhythmic pulsing sound coming from a cave to the west. You see woods on the shore to the east. The dock is to the south.

The rhythmic sound gets louder as you pull up to the western shore of the lake. The sound is coming from a cave in the cliff face. All you can see in the cave is an eerie orange light that is pulsing with the sound. The plane is in the water to the east of you.
You are standing next to the kayak on the western shore of the lake. The cave is to the west of you. The plane is in the water to the east of you.

You are at the cave entrance. There is a velvet rope held up by gold posts blocking the way. To the left of the cave entrance, there is a table with a small cardboard box on it. “Admissions” is written on the front of the box. Your kayak is on the shore to the east.
You are in your kayak on the western side of the lake. The cave is on the shore to west and the plane is in the water to the east
You drop your ticket into the cardboard box. You look over and the velvet rope is gone. The wrist watch is on the table.

You pick up the wrist watch and see that it reads 12:00. It’s a nice watch. Gold rolex. As you are examining it you can feel it getting hotter and hotter. Your hand starts to sear. Then, it goes away. You feel a small weight in your coat that wasn’t there before. You reach in your pocket and find a human canine tooth. You put the watch back where it was.

You are standing on a stage looking out into a grand ballroom full of well-dressed people. About two dozen couples are in the middle of the ballroom in dancing position. The rest of the attendees are in the middle of chatting and drinking. No one is moving—everyone seems to be frozen in time. There is a piano on stage. A vase of roses sits on top of it.

A long hallway stretches out in front of you. The walls are covered with burgundy wallpaper. Lamps with red shades light the way. The sound is blaring now. You can see there is a stage at the end of the hallway with a band playing, but you are too far away to get a good look at whats going on.

You get a clearer picture as you approach the stage. The band is a four-piece - every member must be older than 70. They are all wearing hospital gowns. The music is slow and heavy. Everyone is going through the motions for playing the current song, but there are no instruments or microphones on stage. You realize there are no speakers in the hallway. You notice a photo on the ground.
You pick up the photo. There is a small ruby taped to the back of it.

You are just south of the tongue of the glacier that feeds into the northern side of the lake. You see a black square lodged into the ice cliff to the north of you. A faint chanting sound is coming from that direction. There is a fishing boat wrecked in the water to the west of you.

The inside of the boat is in shambles. Chairs are overturned and broken glass is everywhere. Fingernail scratches on the walls. There is a whiteboard on the wall covered in writing. A charred skeleton is propped up in the corner. There are several rings and a gold watch on the skeleton.

You are floating right at the base of the ice cliff. The chanting is significantly louder and now and it sounds aggressive. You don’t recognize the language. You can make out the details of the black square now. It’s a metal filing cabinet drawer lodged in the ice, two feet above the water line. You can access it easily.
The drawer opens easily. Inside you find an emerald and a gold necklace. You take both.

You are standing next to your kayak on the eastern shore of the lake. The sand at your feet is rocky. The treeline starts further inland and you see a path into the woods. Mountains stretch high above the woods further east. The plane is in the water back to the west.
You are in the kayak on the eastern side of the lake. The wooded shore is to the east of you. The plane is to your west.

You walk down the path in the woods until you find a circular clearing. Sun is filtering in through the treetops. There is a statue of a woman in the middle of the clearing. She is cradling a sundial with one arm. The other arm is sticking out towards you, hand upturned. Several silver keys embedded with sapphires are placed on the hand. A message is carved into the base of the statue and a box of muffins is placed just above the message.
A key comes away freely. The sapphire embedded into the key pops out. You take both.
You are on the road that you came from. It stretches to the east. The truck is in the gravel lot is to the west of you.
You are further down the road. You can no longer see the turn into the gravel lot when you look to the west. The road stretches endlessly to the east. Is that someone further down the road?

You are much further down the road. You find a child on the side of the road. They are wearing all yellow and are dusted with dirt. They’re sitting in front of the corpse of a small bird. The bird has been dead for a while judging by the state of decay.
The road stretches endlessly to the east.

The cold water takes your breath away as you get in. The eyeless fish stop circling the plane and begin to surround you. They wrap their mouths around you and begin to drag you down. You start to panic, but you calm down when you realize you're not having any trouble breathing. The fish take you to a giant stone door at the bottom of the lake. The door is locked shut with a strange stone contraption that reminds you of Aztec engineering. Then, the contraption begins to unravel and the door opens to reveal a blinding light. You are gently carried through the open door and...

...you put your hand up to keep the sun out of your eyes. Remy leans over from the driver's seat and pulls down the sun visor for you—it's just out of your reach. He pulls up to the front of the carpool lane and you hop out. Your backpack feels unnatural after not wearing it for three months. You spare a moment to take one last look at Remy before you head through the front doors of Davis Elementary and he heads back to Lansing. 'I'll see you soon'.

Game complete.

You start to panic, but you calm down when you realize you're not having any trouble breathing. The fish take you to a giant stone door at the bottom of the lake. The door is locked shut with a strange stone contraption that reminds you of Aztec engineering. Then, the contraption begins to unravel and the door opens to reveal a blinding light. You are gently carried through the open door and...

...you try to open your eyes but you realize you don't have any. You can feel your fins brushing up against the sides of the other fish around you. The cold doesn't bother you and the circular motion of the school is comforting. You try to remember what Remy had said in that field so long ago while you wait for the next kayak. 'Make Time'. You wonder if you really did.

Game complete.
DUMMY SITUATION, DUMMY. YOU FOUND HELL
